(1983) | Misc = }} "'''Moon 83'''" is a song by the American [[New Wave music|New Wave]] band [[The B-52's]]. It was written by the band and was included as the seventh track on their album ''[[Whammy!]]'' (1983);[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r1077/review|pure_url=yes}} ''Whammy!'': Allmusic Review] in addition, it was later released as the [[A-side and B-side|B-side]] of their [[single (music)|single]] "[[Legal Tender (song)|Legal Tender]]". Originally, "Don't Worry", a [[cover version]] of the [[Yoko Ono]] song "Don't Worry, Kyoko (Mummy's Only Looking For Her Hand in the Snow)" from her 1971 album ''[[Fly (Yoko Ono album)|Fly]]'', was included as the closing track of ''Whammy!''.{{cite web|url=http://www.robertchristgau.com/get_album.php?id=204|title=Robert Christgau Review - B-52's: ''Whammy!''|year=1983|accessdate=2010-03-16|publisher=Robert Christgau: Dean of American Rock Critics|last=Christgau|first=Robert}} However, due to legal issues with Ono, the track with withdrawn and replaced with "Moon 83". Essentially, "Moon 83" is a [[remixed]] version of the track "There's a Moon in the Sky (Called the Moon)", originally included on their 1979 eponymous debut album ''[[The B-52's (album)|The B-52's]]''. The [[percussion]] in "Moon 83" is largely [[synthesized]]; certain parts of the song briefly feature [[bongo drum|bongos]]. The main [[vocals]] are shared by [[Fred Schneider]], [[Kate Pierson]], and [[Cindy Wilson]], who repeat the words "This is the [[Space Age]]" while Schneider's voice repeatedly echoes the words "Others like you." ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{The B-52's}} [[Category:1983 singles]] [[Category:The B-52's songs]] [[Category:Songs written by Fred Schneider]] [[Category:Songs written by Kate Pierson]] [[Category:Songs written by Keith Strickland]] [[Category:Songs written by Cindy Wilson]]
